channel.title: [X]Keyboard and Mouse help (HALP! NEED KOKOA)
channel.description:
Anyways, I have a Logitech MX3000 Keyboard and a Logitech MX600 Mouse. The keyboard and mouse have special buttons on the for going forward/back a page and to zoom in/out. How would I go about configuring xorg.conf to make these work.
Thanks, ~io9`

item.title: [X]Keyboard and Mouse help (HALP! NEED KOKOA)
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

Yer I was wondering about this myself. Halpz pl0x?!
http://linuxgazette.net/104/brown.html
mebe?

Read full topic

item.title: [X]Keyboard and Mouse help (HALP! NEED KOKOA)
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:2, topic:157398”]you need to note down the key_code with xev
something like:
xev
then press any button and look for the key_code
after that, use some hotkey program to add these[/quote]
I do believe there is some configuration you can do in xorg.conf. Thanks though.

Read full topic
